intro: Noltia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. These plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that often display vibrant yellow or orange hues. Noltia species are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. They are perennial herbs with opposite leaves and produce small, capsule-like fruits. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens.
